eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
An example allows to check some settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangleMovement

events.comment: Set the initial state according to the configuration.
Update the rectangle when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Move the object on the rectangular path.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Step on the path.

eventsFunctions.description: Teleport the object to a corner of the movement rectangle.
eventsFunctions.name: TeleportToCorner
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the position of _PARAM0_ at the _PARAM2_ of the rectangle loop

eventsFunctions.description: Return the perimeter of the movement rectangle.
eventsFunctions.name: Perimeter

eventsFunctions.description: Return the time the object takes to go through the whole rectangle (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the time the object takes to go through a vertical edge (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.name: Height

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: BrakingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

events.comment: Find how far to go to reach a pixel.

parameters: Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetX() + Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize() * ceil((Object.X() + PixelPerfectMovement::BrakingDistance(Object.TopDownMovement::XVelocity(), Object.TopDownMovement::Deceleration()) - Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetX()) / Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize())

Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetX() + Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize() * floor((Object.X() - PixelPerfectMovement::BrakingDistance(Object.TopDownMovement::XVelocity(), Object.TopDownMovement::Deceleration()) - Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetX()) / Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize())

events.comment: Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.

parameters: Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetY() + Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize() * ceil((Object.Y() + PixelPerfectMovement::BrakingDistance(Object.TopDownMovement::YVelocity(), Object.TopDownMovement::Deceleration()) - Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetY()) / Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize())

Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetY() + Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize() * floor((Object.Y() - PixelPerfectMovement::BrakingDistance(Object.TopDownMovement::YVelocity(), Object.TopDownMovement::Deceleration()) - Object.Behavior::PropertyOffsetY()) / Object.Behavior::PropertyPixelSize())

events.comment: Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

The "separate" action can leave the object position with rounding errors.
The snaping is applied doStepPostEvent rather than at the beginning of doPreEvent because it must be done before the top-down movement is applied.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap on the grid horizontally to remove rounding errors that could happen with the separate action.
eventsFunctions.name: SnapRoundingErrorX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM0_ on the grid horizontally if there is any rounding error

eventsFunctions.description: Snap on the grid vertically to remove rounding errors that could happen with the separate action.
eventsFunctions.name: SnapRoundingErrorY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM0_ on the grid vertically if there is any rounding error

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.
